body_html:
System information

  • I have not written any custom code
  • OS Platform and Distribution :Debian GNU/Linux 9.5(GCP instance)
  • Tensorflow installed using pip
  • TensorFlow version:1.10.1
  • Python version: 2.7.13
  • CUDA Version: 9.2.148
  • GPU model and memory: none
  • Exact command to reproduce:
    Dataset- DeepFashion-https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B7EVK8r0v71pWGplNFhjc01NbzQ
    val_attr.npy file - https://drive.google.com/open?id=16Mya14JIojI8qOUnDtiR2etpKggkh7nn

import numpy as np
import tensorflow as tf

val_attr=np.load('/home/balajib26/new_exp/DeepFashion-Tensorflow/val_attr.npy')

def _int64_feature(value):
return tf.train.Feature(int64_list=tf.train.Int64List(value=[value]))

def _bytes_feature(value):
return tf.train.Feature(bytes_list=tf.train.BytesList(value=[value]))

feature = { 'val_attr': _int64_feature(val_attr)}

error:
TypeError Traceback (most recent call last)
in ()
----> 1 feature = { 'val_attr': _int64_feature(val_attr)}

in _int64_feature(value)
1 def _int64_feature(value):
----> 2 return tf.train.Feature(int64_list=tf.train.Int64List(value=[value]))
3
4 # _bytes is used for string/char values
5

TypeError: only size-1 arrays can be converted to Python scalars

body:
### System information
- I have not written any custom code
- OS Platform and Distribution :Debian GNU/Linux 9.5(GCP instance)
- Tensorflow installed using pip
- TensorFlow version:1.10.1
- Python version: 2.7.13
- CUDA Version: 9.2.148
- GPU model and memory: none
- Exact command to reproduce:
Dataset- DeepFashion-https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B7EVK8r0v71pWGplNFhjc01NbzQ
val_attr.npy file - https://drive.google.com/open?id=16Mya14JIojI8qOUnDtiR2etpKggkh7nn

import numpy as np
import tensorflow as tf

val_attr=np.load('/home/balajib26/new_exp/DeepFashion-Tensorflow/val_attr.npy')

def _int64_feature(value):
    return tf.train.Feature(int64_list=tf.train.Int64List(value=[value]))

def _bytes_feature(value):
    return tf.train.Feature(bytes_list=tf.train.BytesList(value=[value]))

feature = { 'val_attr': _int64_feature(val_attr)}

error:
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-27-d64c9fcc250b> in <module>()
----> 1 feature = { 'val_attr': _int64_feature(val_attr)}

<ipython-input-19-c554b2e04247> in _int64_feature(value)
      1 def _int64_feature(value):
----> 2     return tf.train.Feature(int64_list=tf.train.Int64List(value=[value]))
      3 
      4 # _bytes is used for string/char values
      5 

TypeError: only size-1 arrays can be converted to Python scalars
